results.definition: the state of being in effect or being operative
examples: that rule is no longer in operation

results.definition: a business especially one run on a large scale
examples: a large-scale farming operation
a multinational operation
they paid taxes on every stage of the operation
they had to consolidate their operations

results.definition: a planned activity involving many people performing various actions
examples: they organized a rescue operation
the biggest police operation in French history
running a restaurant is quite an operation
consolidate the companies various operations

results.definition: (computer science) data processing in which the result is completely specified by a rule (especially the processing that results from a single instruction)
examples: it can perform millions of operations per second

results.definition: activity by a military or naval force (as a maneuver or campaign)
examples: it was a joint operation of the navy and air force

results.definition: a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed to repair damage or arrest disease in a living body
examples: they will schedule the operation as soon as an operating room is available
he died while undergoing surgery

results.definition: a process or series of acts especially of a practical or mechanical nature involved in a particular form of work
examples: the operations in building a house
certain machine tool operations

results.definition: process or manner of functioning or operating
examples: the power of its engine determines its operation
the plane's operation in high winds
they compared the cooking performance of each oven
the jet's performance conformed to high standards

results.definition: (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity; an operation that affects mental contents
examples: the process of thinking
the cognitive operation of remembering
the problems at the end of the chapter demonstrated the mathematical processes involved in the derivation
they were learning the basic operations of arithmetic

results.definition: the activity of operating something (a machine or business etc.)
examples: her smooth operation of the vehicle gave us a surprisingly comfortable ride
